importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Since the winter of 2022, Russia has targeted Ukraine’s energy infrastructure, initiating a sustained campaign that has disrupted power and heating systems.
This date marks the latest major drone and missile strike on Kyiv’s Thermal Station 5, signaling a shift in Russian tactics aimed at crippling Ukraine’s winter resilience.
A previous major attack on an eastern Kyiv factory and apartment building resulted in civilian deaths and highlighted the vulnerability of Ukrainian infrastructure to Russian missile strikes.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: From 2022 onward, Russia has systematically targeted Ukraine’s energy infrastructure, escalating attacks in a new phase focused on winter readiness and civilian survival.

keyTakeAways: Russia has intensified attacks on Ukraine’s power and heating stations, using hundreds of modified drones and missiles to achieve surgical destruction.
The October 10, 2025 attack on Kyiv’s Thermal Station 5 destroyed critical energy infrastructure, leaving the city without power and running water for much of the day.
Russia’s missile software updates have significantly reduced interception rates — from 37% in August to just 6% in September — undermining Western air defense systems.
The attacks are part of a deliberate strategy to leave Ukrainian civilians defenseless during an expected harsh winter with heavy snowfall and subzero temperatures.
Corruption within Ukraine’s anticorruption agencies has contributed to ineffective defense measures, such as placing sandbags around power stations instead of burying them underground.
Ukrainian civilians are preparing for blackouts by stockpiling power banks, gas canisters, battery-powered blankets, and alternative heating solutions like wood stoves.
Residents have adapted by relying on natural gas for cooking and heating, such as at Arslan Atamuradov’s shawarma kiosk in Kyiv, which has shifted from electric to gas-powered operations.
Energy Minister Mykola Kolesnik confirmed over six strikes on natural gas delivery facilities in early October, and announced plans to increase natural gas imports from Europe.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Russia has intensified its attacks on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure, particularly targeting power stations and natural gas delivery systems, with a surgical drone strike on Kyiv’s Thermal Station 5 on October 10, 2025, destroying critical facilities and leaving the city without power and running water. This marks a strategic shift in Russian tactics aimed at leaving Ukrainian civilians defenseless during an expected harsh winter. Russia has modified drones and missiles to evade Western air defenses, reducing interception rates from 37% to 6% between August and September. Corrupt practices within Ukraine’s government have undermined infrastructure protection efforts, such as placing sandbags instead of burying power stations. As a result, civilians are stockpiling power banks, gas canisters, and alternative heating solutions. The attacks have significantly strained Ukraine’s energy capacity, raising concerns about a severe winter with widespread blackouts and humanitarian consequences.
title: How Russia’s new tactics pose fresh winter threat to Ukraine
